parcel.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an object that has been wrapped in paper or put in a special envelope, especially so that it can be sent by post
parcel.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The parcel was delivered last week.
He sends regular food parcels to his family in Libya.
a parcel of clothes and blankets
parcel.translation[0].definitions[1].def: an area of land that is part of a larger area which has been divided up
parcel.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a small quantity of food that has been wrapped up, usually in pastry
parcel.translation[2].definitions[0].def: an object or objects, packed together and wrapped up ready to be sent somewhere
parcel.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The next lot of parcels is being delivered tomorrow.
parcel post (=a mail service for collecting and delivering parcels)
parcel.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a piece of land that is one of several parts of a larger area of land
parcel.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The company owns 76 parcels of industrial land in 23 states.
HTV is redeveloping a 21-acre parcel of land close to its studios.
parcel.translation[2].definitions[2].def: a set of related shares etc that are all sold or bought at the same time
parcel.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: They sold a big parcel of shares last week for £82.6 million.
